top_comments_top.body: Depends. What system you on? If pc there’s valorant csgo both F2P there’s squad hell let loose I’ve been enjoying bf4 and bf5. I’d stay away from CoD

Battlefield is probably the most casual one.

Can't hurt to give one of those a try. Any of the ones that didn't release this year will probably be pretty cheap as well.

What is best, depends a bit on what you like. There are FPS games who are played as massive blobs of players trying to kill each other (Like COD Warzone), as smaller more tactically minded teamplayer games (like Rainbow 6 Siege), more casual fun games with fulfilling objectives being the primary goal  (Overwatch), some are realistic military simulations and extremely deadly etc. 

Perhaps you could describe a bit more the style and gameplay you like, what you enjoyed so far in the past etc, because there could be a good dozen or so recommendations for all tastes. 

Otherwise it is a bit like *"I like this thing called "food", what do you recommend?"*. ;-)

SYL

Depends what you're into really. Overwatch, Counter Strike, and the latest Call of Duty are three good places to start. I'd recommend watching a couple streams and then get the one that looks most interesting. 

Personally I'm not a huge fan of FPS PvP but out of those I did enjoy Overwatch.

For starters i would recomend Battelfield or Cod , both games are the most Basic af , with decades of the same funktions and the player Basees both think the other game sucks ass , but you cant compare them because Battelfield is a FPS with big maps many Player up to 32 poeple on each site and CoD is a more fast game with smaler maps and up zo 8 player per map , so both games are good on there terretory but be ware to talk to them about the other game they will cry like Babys and insult you and your famalie. But these to are good for starters and my favorite game is Battelfield .
